TopicTitle: Why does KSP go release instead of a next beta version?

Articles.Content:
Well, yeah. KSP is full of bugs at the moment and, as Maxmaps [stated](https://twitter.com/Maxmaps/status/577678205416419329) on Twitter, 1.0 might have many bugs as well.

Why push out a release when it's clear it will still be in some kind of beta state? Is there any reason for that?

 I'm really curious and I'd like to know. ![:)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_smiley.gif)

Because if they don't say at some point "this is release" then they will be in beta forever, it is very easy to say that you will release "a few versions down the road" 

but setting the deadline will change some of the dev tactics more to bug fixes rather than new (not really necessary) features
Basically because Squad has decided to do so ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
There's an 80 page thread discussing this somewhere.
